subject: Management
title: Disagree and Commit
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Disagree and Commit.

hook.text: A leadership team argued for two days about strategy. Half wanted path A, half wanted path B.

buildup.text: Endless debate is its own form of failure. Sometimes you just need to pick and execute.

discovery.text: Intel's Andy Grove used disagree and commit: voice your objection, then fully support the decision.

twist.text: Half-hearted execution of the right plan fails. Full execution of a decent plan often wins.

climax.text: Once the call is made, everyone rows in the same direction. Revisit later with data.

punchline.text: Argue before the decision. Unite after it.

quiz.question: What does disagree and commit mean?
options: Voice objections, then fully support the group decision
Pretend to agree while secretly opposing the plan
Only commit to decisions you personally agree with
